Articles.Content:
Seriously, the Kerbals have a hard enough time with ladders as it is without putting them through this :/

Does anyone else think they're needlessly difficult to get to?

Cas.

EDIT: I'm mainly referring to the inline cockpit with the hatch on the top, other than that I love everything they've added in 0.25!

Edited October 13, 2014 by Carsogen

I have to do a weird thing with turning the camera and pressing W and D and the same time to get them to go from side ladder to the one built in to the fuselage. But honestly, it's less of a problem with the Mk2 Cockpits specifically and more of a ladder issue in general.

But honestly, it's less of a problem with the Mk2 Cockpits specifically and more of a ladder issue in general.

Haha yeah true, I'm sure it wouldn't be an issue if Kerbals went to ladder school, but I just feel that these hatches just exacerbate an existing issue.

Cas.

The original SpacePlane+ mod had it on the side so that you could only get to it from one side, but it was a lot easier to access. Not really sure why they changed it. Since the science lab demonstrates the ability for two hatches, I can't see why they cant just have it on the side and then mirror it. Seems easy enough and it's truer to the original mod, which was pretty damn flawless IMHO.

I have to do a weird thing with turning the camera and pressing W and D and the same time to get them to go from side ladder to the one built in to the fuselage. But honestly, it's less of a problem with the Mk2 Cockpits specifically and more of a ladder issue in general.

It would certainly help if the ladder would line up with the ladders of the other units (lab, landercans, cupola, storage unit)
